page.title: 12INTERVIEW-RNLI(cont)
page.content: craft,only rarely is it that fishermen have to be rescued.Most are because of engine trouble or the pleasure craft does not know the area or tides. Mr. Taylor's family has been with lifeboats for 350 years.His most memorable moment was just after The Second World War when the whole lifeboat crew were Taylors.to Mr.Taylor just saving someones life is memorable. Every so often an inspector comes round to inspect the whole station to make sure it is all in top condition. The natural features of the area hinder the rescues.The piers have changed the tides of the area.The tides run parallel with the coast.The current goes out faster than it comes in so this means the lifeboat can get out to sea quicker with this tide but the current is dangerous for bathers.
